Name: Sarcophagus of a falcon
Description: This bronze object (also inventoried under E.6931) was part of the Leopold II collection. It is composed of a large socle, equipped with a short hieroglyphic inscription and a figurine of a falcon wearing the double crown of Egypt. The piece, which dates from the Late Period, constitutes the sarcophagus of a falcon, sacred animal of the royal god Horus
